required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Premature Ventricular Contractions (PVCs) and Blood Pressure Control
clinical_study.official_title: The Effects of PVC Suppression on Blood Pressure Control in Patients With Frequent PVCs

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine if reduction in premature ventricular contraction (PVC) burden results in a decrease in blood pressure, sympathetic outflow, plasma catecholamines and an improvement in baroreflex gain. Flecainide will be used for PVC suppression in a randomized, double-blinded, crossover fashion.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: Mean arterial blood pressure was calculated from non-invasive systolic and diastolic arm measurements.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Muscle Sympathetic Nerve Activity
secondary_outcome.description: Muscle sympathetic nerve activity was measured as number of bursts of neural activity per 100 heart beats.

other_outcome.description: Arterial baroreflex gain is calculated as slope of the relationship between cardiac cycle length and the corresponding change in systolic blood pressure.

arm_group.description: This arm will undergo attempted PVC suppression using flecainide for 28 days and then undergo no PVC suppression using placebo for 28 days.
This arm will undergo no PVC suppression using placebo for 28 days and then undergo attempted PVC suppression using flecainide for 28 days.

intervention.description: Flecainide will be administered to result in a reduction in PVC burden.
Placebo (sugar pills) will be given to result in no alteration in PVC burden.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Frequent symptomatic premature ventricular contractions (PVCs) (>10% of total QRSs on a 24-hour Holter)
- Willingness to participate in research
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age > 65 years old
- Pacemaker implantation
- Implantable cardioverter defibrillator implantation requiring pacing
- Sick sinus syndrome
- Atrio-ventricular (AV) block
- Left ventricular dysfunction defined as left ventricular ejection fraction < 50%
- History of myocardial infarction or coronary artery disease
- Severe left ventricular hypertrophy (wall thickness > 1.5 cm by echocardiography performed within 3 months from enrollment)
- Severe liver dysfunction
- Creatinine clearance of 35 mL/min/1.73 square meters or less
- Pregnancy
- Known hypersensitivity to the drug
- QRS duration > 120 ms
- Recent change in blood pressure medication within 30 days of enrollment

group.title: PVC Suppression Then Placebo
group.description: This arm will undergo attempted PVC suppression using flecainide for 28 days and then undergo no PVC suppression using placebo for 28 days. PVC Suppression using Flecainide: Flecainide will be administered to result in a reduction in PVC burden. No PVC Suppression using Placebo: Placebo (sugar pills) will be given to result in no alteration in PVC burden.

group.description: This arm will undergo no PVC suppression using placebo for 28 days and then undergo attempted PVC suppression using flecainide for 28 days. No PVC Suppression using Placebo: Placebo (sugar pills) will be given to result in no alteration in PVC burden. PVC Suppression using Flecainide: Flecainide will be administered to result in a reduction in PVC burden.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Change in Mean Arterial Pressure
outcome.description: Mean arterial blood pressure was calculated from non-invasive systolic and diastolic arm measurements.
outcome.population: Mean arterial blood pressure values were not available at all time points for every patient. Data on subjects who completed the study is presented here and may not reflect changes seen in a larger population.

group.title: Change From Base 1 to PVC Suppression
group.description: This arm will undergo attempted PVC suppression using flecainide for 28 days and then undergo no PVC suppression using placebo for 28 days. PVC Suppression using Flecainide: Flecainide will be administered to result in a reduction in PVC burden. No PVC Suppression using Placebo: Placebo (sugar pills) will be given to result in no alteration in PVC burden. Change in BP values from baseline to PVC suppression in the group that received flecainide (PVC suppression) first.

group.title: Change From Base 2 to no PVC Suppression
group.description: This arm will undergo attempted PVC suppression using flecainide for 28 days and then undergo no PVC suppression using placebo for 28 days. PVC Suppression using Flecainide: Flecainide will be administered to result in a reduction in PVC burden. No PVC Suppression using Placebo: Placebo (sugar pills) will be given to result in no alteration in PVC burden. Change in BP values from 2nd baseline (washout) to PVC suppression in the group that received flecainide (PVC suppression) first.

group.title: Change From Base 1 to no PVC Suppression
group.description: This arm will undergo no PVC suppression using placebo for 28 days and then undergo attempted PVC suppression using flecainide for 28 days. No PVC Suppression using Placebo: Placebo (sugar pills) will be given to result in no alteration in PVC burden. PVC Suppression using Flecainide: Flecainide will be administered to result in a reduction in PVC burden. Change in BP values from first baseline to no PVC suppression in the group that received placebo (no PVC suppression) first.

group.title: Change From Base 2 to PVC Suppression
group.description: This arm will undergo no PVC suppression using placebo for 28 days and then undergo attempted PVC suppression using flecainide for 28 days. No PVC Suppression using Placebo: Placebo (sugar pills) will be given to result in no alteration in PVC burden. PVC Suppression using Flecainide: Flecainide will be administered to result in a reduction in PVC burden. Change in BP values from 2nd baseline (washout) to PVC suppression in the group that received placebo (no PVC suppression) first.

measure.title: Change in Mean Arterial Pressure
measure.description: Mean arterial blood pressure was calculated from non-invasive systolic and diastolic arm measurements.
measure.population: Mean arterial blood pressure values were not available at all time points for every patient. Data on subjects who completed the study is presented here and may not reflect changes seen in a larger population.

outcome.title: Change in Muscle Sympathetic Nerve Activity
outcome.description: Muscle sympathetic nerve activity was measured as number of bursts of neural activity per 100 heart beats.
outcome.population: SNA values were not obtained in many of the participants in various groups above due to technical difficulties. Data on subjects who underwent the measurement are presented here and may not reflect changes seen in a larger population.

measure.title: Change in Muscle Sympathetic Nerve Activity
measure.description: Muscle sympathetic nerve activity was measured as number of bursts of neural activity per 100 heart beats.
measure.population: SNA values were not obtained in many of the participants in various groups above due to technical difficulties. Data on subjects who underwent the measurement are presented here and may not reflect changes seen in a larger population.

outcome.title: Change in Baroreflex Gain
outcome.description: Arterial baroreflex gain is calculated as slope of the relationship between cardiac cycle length and the corresponding change in systolic blood pressure.
outcome.population: Arterial baroreflex gain values were not available at all time points. In one subject, gain could not be calculated because they were in bigeminy. Data on subjects who completed the study is presented here and may not reflect changes seen in a larger population.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: This study was terminated prematurely due to a loss of staff available to make the technical measurements involved. The small number of data points available lead us to conclude the data is uninterpretable.
